  • src.orchestration.fixture_flow

Source code for src.orchestration.fixture_flow

  1"""Overview of fixture flow.
  2
  3This module bundles fixture flow logic for the kgfoundry stack. It groups related helpers so
  4downstream packages can import a single cohesive namespace. Refer to the functions and classes below
  5for implementation specifics.
  6"""
  7
  8from __future__ import annotations
  9
 10from pathlib import Path
 11from typing import Final
 12
 13from prefect import flow, task
 14
 15from kgfoundry_common.models import Doc
 16from kgfoundry_common.navmap_types import NavMap
 17from kgfoundry_common.parquet_io import ParquetChunkWriter, ParquetVectorWriter
 18from registry.helper import DuckDBRegistryHelper
 19
 20__all__ = [
 21    "fixture_pipeline",
 22    "t_prepare_dirs",
 23    "t_register_in_duckdb",
 24    "t_write_fixture_chunks",
 25    "t_write_fixture_dense",
 26    "t_write_fixture_splade",
 27]
 28
 29__navmap__: Final[NavMap] = {
 30    "title": "orchestration.fixture_flow",
 31    "synopsis": "Prefect flows that build local fixture datasets",
 32    "exports": __all__,
 33    "sections": [
 34        {
 35            "id": "public-api",
 36            "title": "Public API",
 37            "symbols": __all__,
 38        },
 39    ],
 40    "module_meta": {
 41        "owner": "@orchestration",
 42        "stability": "experimental",
 43        "since": "0.1.0",
 44    },
 45    "symbols": {
 46        name: {
 47            "owner": "@orchestration",
 48            "stability": "experimental",
 49            "since": "0.1.0",
 50        }
 51        for name in __all__
 52    },
 53}

 55
 56# [nav:anchor t_prepare_dirs]
 57@task


[docs]
 58def t_prepare_dirs(root: str) -> dict[str, bool]:
 59    """Compute t prepare dirs.
 60
 61    Carry out the t prepare dirs operation for the surrounding component. Generated documentation highlights how this helper collaborates with neighbouring utilities. Callers rely on the routine to remain stable across releases.
 62    
 63    Parameters
 64    ----------
 65    root : str
 66        Description for ``root``.
 67    
 68    Returns
 69    -------
 70    collections.abc.Mapping
 71        Description of return value.
 72    
 73    Examples
 74    --------
 75    >>> from orchestration.fixture_flow import t_prepare_dirs
 76    >>> result = t_prepare_dirs(...)
 77    >>> result  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
 78    ...
 79    """
 80
 81    path = Path(root)
 82    (path / "parquet" / "dense").mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
 83    (path / "parquet" / "sparse").mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
 84    (path / "parquet" / "chunks").mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
 85    (path / "catalog").mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
 86    return {"ok": True}


 87
 88
 89# [nav:anchor t_write_fixture_chunks]
 90@task


[docs]
 91def t_write_fixture_chunks(chunks_root: str) -> tuple[str, int]:
 92    """Compute t write fixture chunks.
 93
 94    Carry out the t write fixture chunks operation for the surrounding component. Generated documentation highlights how this helper collaborates with neighbouring utilities. Callers rely on the routine to remain stable across releases.
 95    
 96    Parameters
 97    ----------
 98    chunks_root : str
 99        Description for ``chunks_root``.
100    
101    Returns
102    -------
103    Tuple[str, int]
104        Description of return value.
105    
106    Examples
107    --------
108    >>> from orchestration.fixture_flow import t_write_fixture_chunks
109    >>> result = t_write_fixture_chunks(...)
110    >>> result  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
111    ...
112    """
113
114    writer = ParquetChunkWriter(chunks_root, model="docling_hybrid", run_id="fixture")
115    rows = [
116        {
117            "chunk_id": "urn:chunk:fixture:0-28",
118            "doc_id": "urn:doc:fixture:0001",
119            "section": "Intro",
120            "start_char": 0,
121            "end_char": 28,
122            "doctags_span": {"node_id": "n1", "start": 0, "end": 28},
123            "text": "Hello fixture text about LLMs",
124            "tokens": 5,
125            "created_at": 0,
126        }
127    ]
128    dataset_root = writer.write(rows)
129    return dataset_root, len(rows)


130
131
132# [nav:anchor t_write_fixture_dense]
133@task


[docs]
134def t_write_fixture_dense(dense_root: str) -> tuple[str, int]:
135    """Compute t write fixture dense.
136
137    Carry out the t write fixture dense operation for the surrounding component. Generated documentation highlights how this helper collaborates with neighbouring utilities. Callers rely on the routine to remain stable across releases.
138    
139    Parameters
140    ----------
141    dense_root : str
142        Description for ``dense_root``.
143    
144    Returns
145    -------
146    Tuple[str, int]
147        Description of return value.
148    
149    Examples
150    --------
151    >>> from orchestration.fixture_flow import t_write_fixture_dense
152    >>> result = t_write_fixture_dense(...)
153    >>> result  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
154    ...
155    """
156
157    writer = ParquetVectorWriter(dense_root)
158    vector = [0.0] * 2560
159    out_root = writer.write_dense(
160        "Qwen3-Embedding-4B", "fixture", 2560, [("urn:chunk:fixture:0-28", vector, 1.0)], shard=0
161    )
162    return out_root, 1


163
164
165# [nav:anchor t_write_fixture_splade]
166@task


[docs]
167def t_write_fixture_splade(sparse_root: str) -> tuple[str, int]:
168    """Compute t write fixture splade.
169
170    Carry out the t write fixture splade operation for the surrounding component. Generated documentation highlights how this helper collaborates with neighbouring utilities. Callers rely on the routine to remain stable across releases.
171    
172    Parameters
173    ----------
174    sparse_root : str
175        Description for ``sparse_root``.
176    
177    Returns
178    -------
179    Tuple[str, int]
180        Description of return value.
181    
182    Examples
183    --------
184    >>> from orchestration.fixture_flow import t_write_fixture_splade
185    >>> result = t_write_fixture_splade(...)
186    >>> result  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
187    ...
188    """
189
190    writer = ParquetVectorWriter(sparse_root)
191    out_root = writer.write_splade(
192        "SPLADE-v3-distilbert",
193        "fixture",
194        [("urn:chunk:fixture:0-28", [1, 7, 42], [0.3, 0.2, 0.1])],
195        shard=0,
196    )
197    return out_root, 1

200# [nav:anchor t_register_in_duckdb]
201@task


[docs]
202def t_register_in_duckdb(
203    db_path: str,
204    chunks_info: tuple[str, int],
205    dense_info: tuple[str, int],
206    sparse_info: tuple[str, int],
207) -> dict[str, list[str]]:
208    """Compute t register in duckdb.
209
210    Carry out the t register in duckdb operation for the surrounding component. Generated documentation highlights how this helper collaborates with neighbouring utilities. Callers rely on the routine to remain stable across releases.
211    
212    Parameters
213    ----------
214    db_path : str
215        Description for ``db_path``.
216    chunks_info : Tuple[str, int]
217        Description for ``chunks_info``.
218    dense_info : Tuple[str, int]
219        Description for ``dense_info``.
220    sparse_info : Tuple[str, int]
221        Description for ``sparse_info``.
222    
223    Returns
224    -------
225    collections.abc.Mapping
226        Description of return value.
227    
228    Examples
229    --------
230    >>> from orchestration.fixture_flow import t_register_in_duckdb
231    >>> result = t_register_in_duckdb(..., ..., ..., ...)
232    >>> result  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
233    ...
234    """
235
236    registry = DuckDBRegistryHelper(db_path)
237    dense_run = registry.new_run("dense_embed", "Qwen3-Embedding-4B", "main", {"dim": 2560})
238    sparse_run = registry.new_run("splade_encode", "SPLADE-v3-distilbert", "main", {"topk": 256})
239
240    ds_chunks = registry.begin_dataset("chunks", dense_run)
241    registry.commit_dataset(ds_chunks, chunks_info[0], rows=chunks_info[1])
242
243    ds_dense = registry.begin_dataset("dense", dense_run)
244    registry.commit_dataset(ds_dense, dense_info[0], rows=dense_info[1])
245
246    ds_sparse = registry.begin_dataset("sparse", sparse_run)
247    registry.commit_dataset(ds_sparse, sparse_info[0], rows=sparse_info[1])
248
249    registry.register_documents(
250        [
251            Doc(
252                id="urn:doc:fixture:0001",
253                title="Fixture Doc",
254                authors=[],
255                pdf_uri="/dev/null",
256                source="fixture",
257                openalex_id=None,
258                doi=None,
259                arxiv_id=None,
260                pmcid=None,
261                pub_date=None,
262                license="CC0",
263                language="en",
264                content_hash="",
265            )
266        ]
267    )
268    registry.close_run(dense_run, True)
269    registry.close_run(sparse_run, True)
270    return {"runs": [dense_run, sparse_run]}


271
272
273# [nav:anchor fixture_pipeline]
274@flow(name="kgfoundry_fixture_pipeline")


[docs]
275def fixture_pipeline(
276    root: str = "/data", db_path: str = "/data/catalog/catalog.duckdb"
277) -> dict[str, list[str]]:
278    """Compute fixture pipeline.
279
280    Carry out the fixture pipeline operation for the surrounding component. Generated documentation highlights how this helper collaborates with neighbouring utilities. Callers rely on the routine to remain stable across releases.
281    
282    Parameters
283    ----------
284    root : str | None
285        Optional parameter default ``'/data'``. Description for ``root``.
286    db_path : str | None
287        Optional parameter default ``'/data/catalog/catalog.duckdb'``. Description for ``db_path``.
288    
289    Returns
290    -------
291    collections.abc.Mapping
292        Description of return value.
293    
294    Examples
295    --------
296    >>> from orchestration.fixture_flow import fixture_pipeline
297    >>> result = fixture_pipeline()
298    >>> result  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS
299    ...
300    """
301
302    t_prepare_dirs(root)
303    chunks_info = t_write_fixture_chunks(f"{root}/parquet/chunks")
304    dense_info = t_write_fixture_dense(f"{root}/parquet/dense")
305    sparse_info = t_write_fixture_splade(f"{root}/parquet/sparse")
306    return t_register_in_duckdb(db_path, chunks_info, dense_info, sparse_info)


307
308
309if __name__ == "__main__":
310    fixture_pipeline()
